intro: Commicarpus macrothamnus, commonly known as the large-leaved commicarpus, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces distinctive, inflated pods that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
